trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with TOPdesk - Secure | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with TOPdesk - Secure | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use TOPdesk - Secure with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use TOPdesk - Secure with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with TOPdesk - Secure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with TOPdesk - Secure

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529789).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529789).

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and TOPdesk - Secure.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and TOPdesk - Secure.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A TOPdesk - Secure single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A TOPdesk - Secure single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to TOPdesk - Secure will be able to single sign into the application at your TOPdesk - Secure company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to TOPdesk - Secure will be able to single sign into the application at your TOPdesk - Secure company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for TOPdesk - Secure
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for TOPdesk - Secure

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for TOPdesk - Secure
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for TOPdesk - Secure

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for TOPdesk - Secure.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for TOPdesk - Secure.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for TOPdesk - Secure, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for TOPdesk - Secure, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Active Directory

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: Applications
trans-unit.target: Applications

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Add application
trans-unit.target: Add application

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Add an application from gallerry
trans-unit.target: Add an application from gallerry

trans-unit.source: In the **search box**, type **TOPdesk - Secure**.
trans-unit.target: In the **search box**, type **TOPdesk - Secure**.

trans-unit.source: Application Gallery
trans-unit.target: Application Gallery

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select **TOPdesk - Secure**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select **TOPdesk - Secure**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: TOPdesk - Secure
trans-unit.target: TOPdesk - Secure

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to TOPdesk - Secure with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to TOPdesk - Secure with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for TOPdesk - Secure requires you to upload a logo icon file.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for TOPdesk - Secure requires you to upload a logo icon file.

trans-unit.source: To get the icon file, contact the TOPdesk support team.
trans-unit.target: To get the icon file, contact the TOPdesk support team.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Sign on to your **TOPdesk - Secure** company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sign on to your **TOPdesk - Secure** company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the **TOPdesk** menu, click **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: In the **TOPdesk** menu, click **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Settings
trans-unit.target: Settings

trans-unit.source: Click **Login Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Login Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Login Settings
trans-unit.target: Login Settings

trans-unit.source: Expand the **Login Settings** menu, and then click **General**.
trans-unit.target: Expand the **Login Settings** menu, and then click **General**.

trans-unit.source: General
trans-unit.target: General

trans-unit.source: In the **Secure** section of the **SAML login** configuration section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the **Secure** section of the **SAML login** configuration section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Technical Settings
trans-unit.target: Technical Settings

trans-unit.source: Click **Download** to download the public metadata file, and then save it locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Click **Download** to download the public metadata file, and then save it locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Open the metadata file, and then locate the **AssertionConsumerService** node.
trans-unit.target: Open the metadata file, and then locate the **AssertionConsumerService** node.

trans-unit.source: ![Assertion Consumer Service](./media/active-directory-saas-topdesk-secure-tutorial/IC790856.png "Assertion Consumer Service")
trans-unit.target: ![Assertion Consumer Service](./media/active-directory-saas-topdesk-secure-tutorial/IC790856.png "Assertion Consumer Service")

trans-unit.source: Copy the **AssertionConsumerService** value.
trans-unit.target: Copy the **AssertionConsumerService** value.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You will need the value in the **Configure App URL** section later in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You will need the value in the **Configure App URL** section later in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your **Azure Active Directory** portal as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your **Azure Active Directory** portal as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: On the **TOPdesk - Secure** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the **TOPdesk - Secure** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: On the **How would you like users to sign on to TOPdesk - Secure** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **How would you like users to sign on to TOPdesk - Secure** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure App URL** page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure App URL** page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Configure App URL
trans-unit.target: Configure App URL

trans-unit.source: In the **TOPdesk - Secure Sign On URL** textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign into your TOPdesk - Secure application (e.g.: "*https://qssolutions.topdesk.net*").
trans-unit.target: In the **TOPdesk - Secure Sign On URL** textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign into your TOPdesk - Secure application (e.g.: "*https://qssolutions.topdesk.net*").

trans-unit.source: In the **TOPdesk – Public Reply URL** textbox, paste the **TOPdesk - Secure AssertionConsumerService URL** (e.g.: "*https://qssolutions.topdesk.net/tas/public/login/saml*")
trans-unit.target: In the **TOPdesk – Public Reply URL** textbox, paste the **TOPdesk - Secure AssertionConsumerService URL** (e.g.: "*https://qssolutions.topdesk.net/tas/public/login/saml*")

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure single sign-on at TOPdesk - Secure** page, to download your metadata file, click **Download metadata**, and then save the file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure single sign-on at TOPdesk - Secure** page, to download your metadata file, click **Download metadata**, and then save the file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: To create a certificate file, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To create a certificate file, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Certificate
trans-unit.target: Certificate

trans-unit.source: Open the downloaded metadata file.
trans-unit.target: Open the downloaded metadata file.

trans-unit.source: Expand the **RoleDescriptor** node that has a **xsi:type** of **fed:ApplicationServiceType**.
trans-unit.target: Expand the **RoleDescriptor** node that has a **xsi:type** of **fed:ApplicationServiceType**.

trans-unit.source: Copy the value of the **X509Certificate** node.
trans-unit.target: Copy the value of the **X509Certificate** node.

trans-unit.source: Save the copied **X509Certificate** value locally on your computer in a file.
trans-unit.target: Save the copied **X509Certificate** value locally on your computer in a file.

trans-unit.source: On your TOPdesk - Secure company site, in the **TOPdesk** menu, click **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: On your TOPdesk - Secure company site, in the **TOPdesk** menu, click **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Settings
trans-unit.target: Settings

trans-unit.source: Click **Login Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Login Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Login Settings
trans-unit.target: Login Settings

trans-unit.source: Expand the **Login Settings** menu, and then click **General**.
trans-unit.target: Expand the **Login Settings** menu, and then click **General**.

trans-unit.source: General
trans-unit.target: General

trans-unit.source: In the **Public** section, click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Public** section, click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Add
trans-unit.target: Add

trans-unit.source: On the **SAML configuration assistant** dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **SAML configuration assistant** dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: SAML Configuration Assistant
trans-unit.target: SAML Configuration Assistant

trans-unit.source: To upload your downloaded metadata file, under **Federation Metadata**, click **Browse**.
trans-unit.target: To upload your downloaded metadata file, under **Federation Metadata**, click **Browse**.

trans-unit.source: To upload your certificate file, under **Certificate (RSA)**, click **Browse**.
trans-unit.target: To upload your certificate file, under **Certificate (RSA)**, click **Browse**.

trans-unit.source: To upload the logo file you got from the TOPdesk support team, under **Logo icon**, click **Browse**.
trans-unit.target: To upload the logo file you got from the TOPdesk support team, under **Logo icon**, click **Browse**.

trans-unit.source: In the **User name attribute** textbox, type **http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress**.
trans-unit.target: In the **User name attribute** textbox, type **http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Display name** textbox, type a name for your configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the **Display name** textbox, type a name for your configuration.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete** to close the **Configure Single Sign On** dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete** to close the **Configure Single Sign On** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into TOPdesk - Secure, they must be provisioned into TOPdesk - Secure.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into TOPdesk - Secure, they must be provisioned into TOPdesk - Secure.

trans-unit.source: In the case of TOPdesk - Secure, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of TOPdesk - Secure, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Sign on to your **TOPdesk - Secure** company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sign on to your **TOPdesk - Secure** company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click **TOPdesk \> New \> Support Files \> Operator**.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click **TOPdesk \> New \> Support Files \> Operator**.

trans-unit.source: Operator
trans-unit.target: Operator

trans-unit.source: On the **New Operator** dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **New Operator** dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: New Operator
trans-unit.target: New Operator

trans-unit.source: Click the General tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the General tab.

trans-unit.source: In the **Surname** textbox of the **General** section, type the last name of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the **Surname** textbox of the **General** section, type the last name of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Select a **Site** for the account in the **Location** section.
trans-unit.target: Select a **Site** for the account in the **Location** section.

trans-unit.source: In the **Login Name** textbox of the **TOPdesk Login** section, type a login name for your user.
trans-unit.target: In the **Login Name** textbox of the **TOPdesk Login** section, type a login name for your user.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can use any other TOPdesk - Secure user account creation tools or APIs provided by TOPdesk - Secure to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can use any other TOPdesk - Secure user account creation tools or APIs provided by TOPdesk - Secure to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to TOPdesk - Secure, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to TOPdesk - Secure, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the **TOPdesk - Secure **application integration page, click **Assign users**.
trans-unit.target: On the **TOPdesk - Secure **application integration page, click **Assign users**.

trans-unit.source: Assign Users
trans-unit.target: Assign Users

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
